alert.note: Alert for Bear Lake and Bear River Valley; Cache Valley, Utah Portion; Wasatch Back; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Western Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 03 at 3:04PM MST until January 06 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM TUESDAY TO 5 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. In the valleys, total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches with locally higher amounts. In the mountains, 1 to 2 feet with locally higher amounts in the mountains. * WHERE...In Wyoming, Southwest Wyoming. In Utah, Cache Valley/Utah Portion, Wasatch Back, Bear Lake and Bear River Valley, Wasatch Mountains I-80 North, Wasatch Mountains South of I-80 and Western Uinta Mountains. * WHEN...From 5 AM Tuesday to 5 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong winds in the mountains and across southwest Wyoming will lead to areas of blowing and drifting snow. In particular, Interstate 80 in southwest Wyoming and Sardine and Logan Summits in Utah will be especially prone to blowing snow.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov/roadweatherforecast.aspx or dial 511. For winter road conditions from the Wyoming Department of Transportation, visit http://www.wyoroad.info or dial 511.
